page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The block which we are studying now is in the Northen part of the county of Dyfed,in Ceridigion the area is a rural one with many farms,some woodlands run by the Forestry Comision and some privately owned.Most of these are coniferous although some are deciduous. Almost in the middle of our block is the village of Talybont which is one of the largest in Ceridigion.In Talybont the language is mixed beetween English and Welsh but in the surounding countryside the language is mostly Welsh.There are two rivers in our block,(the Leri and the Ceulan) both have a woolen mill on and there is also a flour mill . The North-West corner of our block is a peat bog called Cors Fochno it is one of two in Wales.There are also two Iron Age forts.
